description.narrative:
Slow Food Youth Network (SFYN), formerly Youth Food Movement (YFM), is an international youth movement that is committed to a good,clean <(>&<)> fair food system. After all, food has more impact than you think: it has common ground with almost all societal and ecological challenges of our time. As part of the international Slow Food network, we want good food that is produced as sustainably as possible and for which the farmer receives a fair price.
SFYN believes that we, as young people, must play an important role in the future of food production and consumption. That is why we bring young consumers, producers, farmers, chefs and students closer together. We do this through eat-ins, tastings, (international) events such as World Disco Soup Day and We Feed The Planet, talk showAls Warme Broodjes, meet-up Het Eetcafé and debate It's the food, my friend !, campaigns such as food education and Damn Food Wasteand projects such as the SFYN Academy.
The Slow Food Youth Network is a global movement and is currently based in more than 80 countries. Within this youth network, SFYN is able to monitor agriculture all over the world and to signal the (possible) effects of Dutch agriculture. Climate change and the global food issue are challenges that our generation will have to solve to keep the world livable. As young people between the ages of 18 and 32, and throughout the entire food chain, we pick up this glove ourselves. We no longer want to wait until the generation will finally take big steps ahead of us.Together we are committed to making our food system truly sustainable.
Within this covenant, Jorrit Kiewik, director of SFYN the Netherlands and SFYN Global, will represent our Dutch and international network. He will contribute specific knowledge fromsmall-scale food producers, traditional production methods and consumer needs worldwide. Jorrit has cooperated since the early stages of this covenant. There are also various experienced experts involved within the network who are ready to give advice. The diverse network also guarantees a non-dogmatic view of the discussed playing field and insight from all chain partners. Within this process, SFYN focuses specifically on the effect of the IMVO covenant on young people worldwide. In addition, SFYN represents the ideas of Slow Food, in which "good, clean <(>&<)> fair" are central. Freely translated, this corresponds to good (and traditional) products and producers, a good eye for animal welfare, no negative effects of food production on the environment and a fair price for producers and consumers.

participating-org.narrative: The Slow Food Youth Network, formally known as the The Youth Food Movement is a network of students and young professionals that actively try to change the future of food and farming. Within the network, YFM connects farmer with chef, food designer with lobbyist,and retailer with policy maker. YFM started as a local group of young food activists but has developed into a national movement. The organisation is the frontrunner in the global Slow Food Youth Network and has developed rapidly in the last 5 years. Since 2015, YFM works as a project organization, supporting the creation of new organizations such as Food Cabinet and Food Film Festival. YFM works with the international SFYN network and with the regions.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
